name: Harbour Towers

reviews.text: A student in our group suggested the Harbour Towers and I made the booking on her recommendation. After reading the reviews of this hotel I was a little apprehensive about our upcoming experience but decided to take a chance on the property. Making the group booking with the hotel was easy and Scott was very helpful.
reviews.title: Great for a group

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed December 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Our group rate (for 5 rooms) was $79 / double queen room (4 students in each room) and $109 for a king suite for a parent chaperon traveling with a baby who wanted more space. Note that my single queen room was the same $79 rate but I think that that rate corresponds with the "up-island" local rate. Parking (unlike other reviews) was free of charge - we were given a chit to put in our vehicle and the hotel was fine with us leaving the vehicles for most of the second day.
reviews.title: Okay for ONE night, I guess

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed October 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Most of the rooms were of average quality but seemed clean and well maintained - none of the major problems mentioned in other reviews. My single queen lacked the fridges that the double queens were equipped with but had a coffee maker with both caffeinated and decaffeinated coffee as well as tea. The bathroom looked like it had been recently renovated and was spotless (see pictures). My room had an overhead ceiling fan and a small balcony with sliding glass doors so I was able to get some fresh air during the night. One of the student rooms had shower that didn't seem to work but was fixed quickly by maintenance.
reviews.title: adequate for short stay
Anniversary Gathering
reviews.text: My only minor concerns were as follows:

reviews.title: OK for $99
reviews.text: There was a slightly "burnt" smell in the room - not sure what the source of that was. There was an imprint of an iron on the carpet and when I used the iron in the morning the smell was similar. Could have been a vacuum cleaner with a full bag as well. Check in was a little slow and often there were line-ups at the front desk as there were only two people trying to deal with the logistics of arranging groups. Our rooms were on several different floors which can make supervising a problem for group travelling.

The first time we were at the Harbour Towers, we were given a deluxe room on the very top floor. The view was magnificient as we could watch the seaplane land and take-off. The room was a bit outdated and washroom small but we loved it.....
reviews.title: Wouldn't go back

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed May 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: ..... so there was no reason not to return, right?
reviews.title: Always Great!

likes.liked: — Always very welcoming and nothing is to much trouble.

reviews.text: Wrong! The second time we return, they had booked us on the 3rd floor (rooms with pet owners). It was summer with boiling temperature and the fan wasn't even working properly. The room was small, dark and out-dated. Washroom wasn't even working properly.
reviews.title: I wouldnt recommend the Harbor Tower Hotel and Suites in Victoria BC

likes.disliked: — everything from lobby to our dirty and stinky rooms

reviews.text: On top of it all was the construction outside. The view claimed we faced the mountain but that's quite far fetched considering you're facing the back lot.
reviews.title: Great service at the Harbour Towers

likes.liked: — About 3 mins walk from the Clipper arrival and 10 from the sea plane arrival. Room was really comfortable.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed February 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Upon entering the room, I wanted to change immediately but they had no other rooms available. We had planned to stay there for three nights but cancelled the other two instead.
reviews.title: Great two story penthouse
horrible service for harbor towers victoria
reviews.text: I had checked them on the internet and it showed a bed & breakfast rate of $149n for this month as a pop up ad ,but necessary to call.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed August 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: I called and and was told yes plenty of room and included a buffet breakfast- very courteous- I did not have my credit card with me so she said call back tomorrow with credit card.
reviews.title: Old and dated, not a good stay

likes.liked: — free internet (don't use wireless -it's not free- but cable instead!)
likes.disliked: — the noise on 2nd floor, the beds on 7th floor

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed August 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: I called next day and was told no rate like that would be honored- a room without bed & breakfast was $149 and she knew nothing of the ad.
reviews.title: Good value, great view

reviews.text: I spoke with the "manager" and he knew of the ad but said he would not honor it even though he did have room!!!.
reviews.title: To view or not to view

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed July 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Needless to say we wil not be staying with this poorly rated hotel.
reviews.title: Older Victoria Hotel that is good for a large travelling party

likes.liked: — Size and amount of items in the suites, location
likes.disliked: — Everything looked a bit dated, but was still clean

reviews.text: My family and I had stayed at this hotel last summer and had a very positive experience, so when we decided to visit Victoria again this year with some of my girlfriends I decided to book with Harbour Towers Hotel again. This years experience was a little different than last. The positives were that the staff were very helpful and friendly, and the beds are relatively comfortable. Some of the negatives are, that there were apparently some water problems because when I went to take a shower the water fluctuated between glacier cold and scalding hot the entire time! I has to jump out of the tub at least 10 times to avoid being scalded. All I could think of was thank goodness I am relatively young and could do this without severely injuring myself. I promptly called the front desk and they sent up a repair man, and offered to give us another room. We decline and just asked the the problem be fixed. We did not have time that day to move all of our things to a new room. The front desk did send up a note that evening apologizing and gave us a voucher for 3 breakfasts at the resteraunt in the hotel. When we went to check out, these breakfasts were charged to our room and I had to some what argue with the person helping us that those were not valid charges. Also, the rooms were not air conditioned and this meant that we had to keep the windows open which made for a quite loud night of cars honking etc. We also had a down comforter that had stains on it, and the elevators smelled really badly. So over all we did not have a good experience and I would not stay at this hotel again.
reviews.title: Not such a good experience

reviews.text: We're a family of 4 with two small children. We're visiting Victoria just to have some fun and get away from things at home, that's it.
reviews.title: Had a great stay

reviews.text: So with two young children, we needed a suite with kitchen facilities. Overall, we had a great stay at this hotel and I would recommend it to others!
reviews.title: Almost Perfect except for one major flaw!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed June 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: I mean, considering this is not a 5 star hotel, the rooms including the kitchen were nice (clean, tidy, well kept, lots of linen, utensils etc...). I liked how the dining area, living area and kitchen is basically one big area. The suite was spacious and had plenty of room for my kids to play.
reviews.title: Old and Dated

reviews.text: The service was good. Staff were nice, housekeeping was good.
reviews.title: Great place to stay in Victoria

description: At Harbour Towers Hotel & Suites we believe "It's the little things that make the difference". From our professional front desk personnel to our dedicated room attendants, our ultimate goal is to provide the impeccable service and extra little touches that will make your visit memorable. The Harbour Towers Hotel & Suites offers some of the most spacious and comfortably appointed accommodations in Victoria. Most of our rooms and suites have balconies and many display breathtaking views of the vibrant Inner Harbour or the majestic Olympic Mountains and the Strait of Juan de Fuca. Whether traveling for business or pleasure, you can rest assured that at Harbour Towers Hotel & Suites, your comfort is our primary concern.
